title: 112_s1592
content: The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" may be cited as the short title. Eligibility for farm loans is addressed in the Act. The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" addresses eligibility requirements for farm ownership loans under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act. It includes provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" includes provisions for eligibility requirements for farm ownership loans, specifically mentioning limited liability companies and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. It also outlines special rules regarding determinations for certain operating-only entities. The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" outlines eligibility requirements for farm ownership loans, including special rules for certain operating-only entities determined by the Secretary to meet owner-operator requirements. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act specifies eligibility criteria for farm ownership loans, including provisions for embedded entities to meet direct ownership requirements. Amendments are made to include additional legal entities for conservation and farm operating loans. Amendments to the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act include expanding eligibility criteria for conservation and farm operating loans to include additional legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. The Secretary is expanding eligibility criteria for conservation and farm operating loans to include legal entities deemed appropriate, such as limited liability companies and other entities determined by the Secretary. The eligibility criteria for conservation and farm operating loans are being expanded to include legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary, with specific rules regarding ownership requirements for entities owned by individuals who own family farms. Additionally, amendments are made to Section 321(a) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act regarding emergency loans. Amendments are made to Section 321(a) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act regarding emergency loans, including changes to ownership requirements for legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. Amendments to Section 321(a) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act include changes to ownership requirements for legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary, such as limited liability companies or other legal entities. An entity must meet the direct ownership requirement if it is owned, wholly or partially, by one or more other entities. The amendments to the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act involve changes to ownership requirements for legal entities, such as limited liability companies. An entity must meet the direct ownership requirement if it is owned, wholly or partially, by one or more other entities. Conforming amendments are also made to other sections of the Act. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to change ownership requirements for legal entities, including limited liability companies. The amendments involve updating specific clauses and definitions to include a broader range of legal entities as owners. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include a broader range of legal entities as owners, such as joint operators or owners. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include a broader range of legal entities as owners, such as joint operators or owners. Section 359(c)(2) is amended to specify the clauses of section 302(a)(1) and section 311(a)(1). SEC. 3 amends the purposes of certain direct loans under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act to include refinancing loans. SEC. 4 repeals certain loan term limits for direct loans and eligibility for guaranteed assistance.
